unit_learning_outcomes.description: Consolidate knowledge on guiding children's behaviour and hone strategies for guiding children's behaviour, including transitions.
Understand the Early Years Learning Framework and the accountability requirements as a teacher in terms of the NQF and NQS.
Observe, plan and document the children's learning whilst on PE.
Examine theories of diverse learners and develop strategies for differentiating planning for diverse needs.
Examine the outdoors as a learning space and develop strategies for embedding sustainability in the prior to school setting.
Extend generic skills such as problem-solving, critical analysis, self-awareness, task management, literacy and communication skills.
Engage in active, careful and critical reflective practice.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Preparation of PE folder and associated tasks
Weekly readings from textbooks and other sources

enrolment_rules.description: ECHP222 or ECHP2220 and ECHE220 or ECHE2200

assessments.description: Work samples: Evaluation of outdoor environment (900 words); analysis of  learning outdoors (4 pages); Summative assessment of children- ’s learning (1200 words)
Situational analysis: Analysis of aspects of diversity and identification of implications for teaching (1500 words)
15 day block placement plus 5 observation days in early childhood setting

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Infrequent attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
data.description: This unit incorporates both theoretical and practical aspects of teaching and working in early childhood contexts. Students in this unit will explore and examine theories of learning and develop a critical understanding for (i) observing, recording and planning for diverse learners, (ii) provisioning the outdoors as a learning space for young children, and (iii) embedding sustainability practices in everyday teaching. Students will continue to develop their teaching skills and complete 20 days of Professional Experience in an early childhood setting.
data.title: Professional Experience 5
